head.title: Summing Up: Is Our House Divided by Race?; The Social Cancer

hedline.hl1: Summing Up: Is Our House Divided by Race?; The Social Cancer

abstract.p: Gerald Berke letter says racism is a social cancer that needs to be studied and removed

block.p: Re your series ''How Race Is Lived in America'':
Re your series ''How Race Is Lived in America'':

What is racism? When does it start, and under what conditions? Racism is a behavior that manifests itself socially. It derives from the ability to attach a cultural predisposition to a visible condition: skin color. It has in common all the prejudices we have regarding size, shape, color, speech and so on.

Racism is a social cancer, and it needs to be studied and the burden to the population removed. I am not neutral to African-Americans: I like them. I like the people, the culture, the talents, the society, the wit and the incredible contributions these Americans have made to the success of our country. And it is not a patronizing affection, but a respectful and admiring one and full of gratitude.
Why, then, is there a racist core still hidden within me like some dormant virus waiting to reassert itself?
